channel.title: BBC News - US & Canada
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Hurricane Ida: One million people in Louisiana without power
item.description: Louisiana is assessing the damage after the storm knocked out power for nearly one million people.

item.title: Afghanistan: US drone strike 'eliminates airport bomb threat'
item.description: The strike on a vehicle prevented another suicide bombing by Islamic State, military officials say.

item.title: Bodies of US troops killed in Kabul returned to America
item.description: A "dignified transfer" ceremony takes place at Dover Air Force Base, Delaware, to receive their remains.

item.title: Ed Asner: Lou Grant and Up actor dies aged 91
item.description: He'll be remembered for his roles as TV newsman Lou Grant and the lead voice role in Pixar hit Up.

item.title: Mountain lion: US mother fights off animal attacking her son
item.description: She hit the animal with her bare hands as it attacked the five-year-old at their home in California.

item.title: Robert F Kennedy assassin Sirhan Sirhan recommended for parole
item.description: A parole board calls for Sirhan Sirhan's release, but the decision now goes to California's governor.

item.title: Canada election: Justin Trudeau rally cancelled after angry protests
item.description: Jeering crowds force the Canadian prime minister to call off an election campaign event.

item.title: Covid origin: US spy agencies publish 'inconclusive' report
item.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

item.title: Judge blocks Florida governor’s mask mandate ban
item.description: School mask mandates have caused fierce debates across the US as students return and Delta surges.

item.title: What now for Afghans arriving in America?
item.description: Afghans land to start a new life in the US as hope dims for those left behind to face the Taliban.

item.title: Apple chief executive Tim Cook gets $750m payout
item.description: The award of more than five million Apple shares comes as Mr Cook marks a decade as the firm's boss.

item.title: 'Murder Hornets': Nest of 1,500 eradicated in the US
item.description: A nest of the giant, invasive insects was the first destroyed in Washington this year.

item.title: Delta variant: How to keep kids safe as they return to school
item.description: A return to school for millions of children has many parents worried how to keep kids safe.

item.title: How Afghanistan rattled Asia and emboldened China
item.description: US VP Kamala Harris tries to reassure Asian allies, as many ask: can they still trust America?

item.title: US census: Hispanic and Asian-American driving US population growth
item.description: Newly released data points to sluggish population growth and a more multiracial US.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: The devastating human cost of rising US gun violence
item.description: Deadly shootings are on the rise in many US cities - poorer and black communities are hardest hit.

item.title: Global heating: Study shows impact of 'climate racism' in US
item.description: Black people in the US are subject to double the level of heat stress in cities than whites.

item.title: How US police training compares with the rest of the world
item.description: Amid calls to improve training in the US, we examine how it compares with other developed countries.

item.title: Vauhxx Booker: Black man condemns charges over alleged race attack
item.description: Vauhxx Booker, who alleges two white men threatened to lynch him, is himself charged with assault.

item.title: Covid: Biden to continue Trump's Title 42 migrant expulsions
item.description: The White House plans to continue the controversial Title 42 policy to help combat Covid-19.

item.title: Immigration: Is US-Mexico border seeing a surge in migrants?
item.description: Donald Trump says migrants are crossing the border like the US "has never seen". We've checked the numbers.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: 'Heartbreaking' conditions in US migrant child camp
item.description: An investigation by the BBC has uncovered alarming conditions at a child migrant camp in Texas.

item.title: US migrant camp 'kids feel like they're in prison'
item.description: More than 2,000 migrant children are being detained in an overcrowded camp in Texas ridden with disease.

item.title: Mexico: Risking everything for an American dream
item.description: Thousands of migrants from Central America are making an arduous journey to the US border.

item.title: Children speak of neglect in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Colombia: Migrants risking it all to cross Darien Gap
item.description: It takes up to 20 days, and can be deadly – but everyday hundreds try to cross the border between Panama and Colombia.

item.title: Guatemala: Suffocated youth unafraid of a deadly journey
item.description: Tougher policies and deaths on the road are unlikely to stop Guatemalans from trying to reach the US.

item.title: Towering twin waterspouts spotted by Florida beachgoers
item.description: Twin funnels forming from the sky to the sea off the Florida coast surprised beachgoers.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.

item.title: Storm Henri: Lightning strikes One World Trade Center
item.description: The strike was captured as Storm Henri approached the north-east of the US, bringing heavy rain.

item.title: Turmoil in Afghanistan hits close to home in America too
item.description: Christine's husband was killed in Afghanistan - she's horrified by the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: New York officer rescues fallen man from subway train
item.description: A bystander captured the harrowing moments after a passenger fell unconscious from the platform.

item.title: How technology in the air battles fires on the ground
item.description: Planes equipped with infrared scanners are helping authorities take on historic wildfires in the US.

item.title: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories
item.description: Canada's "Sixties Scoop" saw thousands of indigenous children forcibly removed from their families.

item.title: New Christmas campaign for Canadians held in China
item.description: The campaign is based on efforts around a similar case involving a British journalist fifty years ago.

item.title: New Brunswick outbreak: How a smalltown doctor became a Covid pariah
item.description: After being labelled "patient zero", a small-town physician in Canada was shunned.
